abstract: The Jets face an unusually tough scheduling challenge in a few weeks, playing New England on a Sunday night and then at Denver four days later.
snippet: The Jets face an unusually tough scheduling challenge in a few weeks, playing New England on a Sunday night and then at Denver four days later.
lead_paragraph: The Jets' next two games -- at Buffalo (5-2) next Sunday and at home against the Patriots (5-2) on Nov. 13 -- figure to be pivotal in the race for the A.F.C. East title. At 4-3, the Jets are a game behind, and if they can win both, they will be in no worse than a tie for first place in the division. The Jets would have the tiebreaker advantage over both teams.

headline.main: Should the N.F.L. 'Flex'  the Jets Out of a Sunday Night Game?
